tool.name: Centerline

param.name: GDB Location
param.dialogReference:
Choose your project geodatabase.

*Default is current project geodatabase but you can create your own, ideally it should sit within the workspace location

You do not need a new geodatabase for each Centerline Feature Class.

param.name: Coordinate System
param.displayname: Match Coordinate System to LiDAR DEM
param.dialogReference: Match the coordinate system to your Digital Elevation Model (DEM). *Expected format is 1m x 1m grid format.

param.name: Centerline Name
param.dialogReference:
Choose a unique name for the centerline feature class compatible with a File GeoDatabase.

Additional centerlines may be drawn, so it is a good idea to add your initials or some other additional unique id to the name.

This Polyline Feature Class will be used to draw the Geomorphic Grade Line and is populated with the required RouteID field.

tool.summary: Create a new polyline feature class with ROUTEID field for drawing your Geomorphic Grade Line (GGL).
tool.usage:
IMPORTANT!!! Do not draw more than one centerline feature!

Each evaluated centerline must be it's own feature class. So if you want to redo your centerline, rerun Step 1.

Failure to do so will likely result in a mismatch between the length of your centerline and the number of cross sections and stations created in this step.
